name: RedgateSqlChangeAutomationBuild
description: Build and test databases with Redgate SQL Change Automation
author: Redgate Software

groups.name: nuGetPackageVersionGroup
groups.visibleRule: operation != Test SQL Change Automation Project && operation != Run tSQLt tests

inputs.name: operation
inputs.label: Operation

options.Build SQL Change Automation Project: Build a SQL Change Automation project
options.Build: Build a SQL Source Control project
options.Test SQL Change Automation Project: Test a SQL Change Automation project using tSQLt tests
options.Test: Test a build artifact from a SQL Source Control project using tSQLt tests
options.Run tSQLt tests: Run tSQLt tests in an existing database
options.Publish: Publish a build artifact to a NuGet feed
options.Sync: Sync a build artifact from a SQL Source Control project to a target database

inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the SQL Change Automation operation you want to perform. Build, test, publish or sync.

inputs.name: sqlProj
inputs.label: SQL Change Automation project
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the location of the source-controlled SQL Change Automation project file (.sqlproj) you want to build.
inputs.visibleRule: operation = Build SQL Change Automation Project || operation = Test SQL Change Automation Project

inputs.name: dbFolder
inputs.label: Database folder

options.RootFolder: Database scripts folder is in VCS root
options.SubFolder: Database scripts folder is a sub-folder of the VCS root

inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the location of the source-controlled database you want to build.

inputs.name: subFolderPath
inputs.label: Subfolder Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the path to your source-controlled database.

inputs.name: packageName
inputs.label: Output NuGet package ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: A name for the NuGet package you want to build.
inputs.visibleRule: operation = Build || operation = Build SQL Change Automation Project

inputs.name: tempServerTypeBuild
inputs.label: Temporary server type
inputs.helpMarkDown: During the build step, SQL Change Automation builds a copy of your database on a temporary server. By default, it uses LocalDB for this. If your database uses features that are not supported by LocalDB, such as Full-Text Search, you can use a temporary SQL Server database.
inputs.visibleRule: operation = Build || operation = Build SQL Change Automation Project

inputs.name: tempDatabaseNameBuild
inputs.label: Database
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify an existing database if you wish to use the same database for each build.

inputs.name: tempTrustServerCertificateBuild
inputs.label: Trust Server Certificate
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify whether to force SQL Server to skip certificate validation.

inputs.name: tempEncryptBuild
inputs.label: Encrypt
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify whether SSL encryption is used by SQL Server when a certificate is installed.

inputs.name: passwordBuild
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password should reference a secret variable defined on the Variables tab

inputs.name: useDlmDashboard
inputs.label: DLM Dashboard integration
inputs.helpMarkDown: Send schema information to DLM Dashboard. When the package is built, SQL Change Automation sends schema information, as well as the package ID and package version to DLM Dashboard so any subsequent deployments can be recognised.

inputs.name: DlmDashboardHost
inputs.label: DLM Dashboard host
inputs.helpMarkDown: The hostname of your DLM Dashboard installation.

inputs.name: publishArtifact
inputs.label: Publish Artifact
inputs.helpMarkDown: Publish the output NuGet package as a build artifact.

inputs.name: publishSqlChangeAutomationArtifact
inputs.label: Publish Artifact
inputs.helpMarkDown: Publish the output NuGet package as a build artifact.
inputs.visibleRule: operation = Build SQL Change Automation Project

inputs.name: filterPathBuild
inputs.label: Filter path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to a .scpf filter file. Overrides any existing Filter.scpf file present in the source control repository, and is used when validating the schema. Filter files can be generated by SQL Source Control and SQL Compare.

inputs.name: compareOptionsBuild
inputs.label: SQL Compare options
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify additional SQL Compare options, or remove default options. Comma separated list, prefix a default option with - to remove it.

inputs.name: dataCompareOptionsBuild
inputs.label: SQL Data Compare options
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify additional SQL Data Compare options, or remove default options. Comma separated list, prefix a default option with - to remove it.

inputs.name: transactionIsolationLevelBuild
inputs.label: Transaction isolation level
inputs.helpMarkDown: Transaction isolation level. The isolation level for the transactions during the build operation. Set this to Read Committed or lower if you are experiencing difficulties with linked servers.

inputs.name: queryBatchTimeoutBuild
inputs.label: Query batch timeout (in seconds)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The execution timeout in seconds, for each batch of queries. The default value is 30 seconds. A value of zero indicates no execution timeout.

inputs.name: useSqlDoc
inputs.label: Use Redgate Sql Doc
inputs.visibleRule: buildAdvanced = true || operation = Build SQL Change Automation Project
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option if you want SQL Doc to generate documentation to include in your project.

inputs.name: packageId
inputs.label: NuGet package ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the package you want to test, this should be the same as your build step.

inputs.name: testDatabaseName
inputs.label: Database
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify an existing database with tSQLt tests.

inputs.name: testTrustServerCertificate
inputs.label: Trust Server Certificate
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify whether SSL encryption is used by SQL Server when a certificate is installed.

inputs.name: testEncrypt
inputs.label: Encrypt
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify whether to force SQL Server to skip certificate validation.

inputs.name: testDatabaseUsername
inputs.label: Username
inputs.visibleRule: operation = Run tSQLt tests && testDatabaseAuthMethod != windowsAuth

inputs.name: testDatabasePassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.visibleRule: operation = Run tSQLt tests && testDatabaseAuthMethod != windowsAuth
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password should reference a secret variable defined on the Variables tab

inputs.name: tempServerType
inputs.label: Temporary server type
inputs.helpMarkDown: During the test step, SQL Change Automation creates a copy of your database on a temporary server. By default, it uses LocalDB for this. If your database uses features that are not supported by LocalDB, such as Full-Text Search, you can use a temporary SQL Server database.
inputs.visibleRule: operation = Test || operation = Test SQL Change Automation Project

inputs.name: tempDatabaseName
inputs.label: Database
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify an existing database if you wish to use the same database for each test step.

inputs.name: tempTrustServerCertificate
inputs.label: Trust Server Certificate
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify whether SSL encryption is used by SQL Server when a certificate is installed.

inputs.name: tempEncrypt
inputs.label: Encrypt
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify whether to force SQL Server to skip certificate validation.

inputs.name: password
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password should reference a secret variable defined on the Variables tab.

inputs.name: testAdvanced
inputs.label: Show advanced options
inputs.visibleRule: operation = Test || operation = Test SQL Change Automation Project || operation = Run tSQLt tests

inputs.name: runOnly
inputs.label: Run only specified class/test
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter a single test or test class enclosed in square brackets, for example [testclass].[testname]

inputs.name: useSqlDataGenerator
inputs.label: Use Redgate Sql Data Generator
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option if you want SQL Data Generator to populate your temporary database with test data. Use of SQL Data Generator is not available on hosted build agents.

inputs.name: excludeEnviromentVariables
inputs.label: Exclude enviroment variables
inputs.helpMarkDown: We are converting enviroment variables to sqlCmd parameters for InvokeDatabaseBuild commandlet, please exclude enviroment variables, which you do not want be converted to sqlCmd parameters. You can define many enviroment variables to exclude separated with semicolon, use wildcards is allowed. For example: AGENT_*;TEMP;BUILD_*
inputs.visibleRule: operation = Build SQL Change Automation Project || operation = Build

inputs.name: autoSqlDataGenerator
inputs.label: Generate data

options.autoDataGenerator: Generate data using SQL Data Generator defaults
options.dataGeneratorFile: Generate data using an existing SQL Data Generator project file

inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose whether to specify a project file to generate data, or use the SQL Data Generator defaults. By default, SQL Data Generator will automatically generate 1000 rows of test data per table, generated intelligently based on a column's datatype, name and any keys.

inputs.name: sqlDataGeneratorFile
inputs.label: SQL Data Generator project file
inputs.helpMarkDown: If you already have a SQL Data Generator project file you wish you use, include the path and filename here.

inputs.name: publishTestResults
inputs.label: Publish test results
inputs.helpMarkDown: Display the test results in the build summary.

inputs.name: testResultsFileName
inputs.label: Test results file name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The file name to be used for the test results file. There is no need to include a file extension.

inputs.name: filterPathTest
inputs.label: Filter path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to a .scpf filter file. Overrides any existing Filter.scpf file present in the source control repository, and is used when building the schema for testing. Filter files can be generated by SQL Source Control and SQL Compare.

inputs.name: compareOptionsTest
inputs.label: SQL Compare options
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify additional SQL Compare options, or remove default options. Comma separated list, prefix a default option with - to remove it.

inputs.name: dataCompareOptionsTest
inputs.label: SQL Data Compare options
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify additional SQL Data Compare options, or remove default options. Comma separated list, prefix a default option with - to remove it.

inputs.name: queryBatchTimeoutTest
inputs.label: Query batch timeout (in seconds)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The execution timeout in seconds, for each batch of queries. The default value is 30 seconds. A value of zero indicates no execution timeout.

inputs.name: packageIdPublish
inputs.label: NuGet package ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the package you want to publish, this should be the same as your build step.

inputs.name: nugetFeedUrl
inputs.label: NuGet feed URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: The fully-qualified URL for your NuGet feed.

inputs.name: nugetFeedApiKey
inputs.label: NuGet feed API key
inputs.helpMarkDown: If you're using a private NuGet feed, enter an API key to access the NuGet feed.

inputs.name: packageIdSync
inputs.label: NuGet package ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the name of the package you want to use to update the target database. It must be a package built by SQL Change Automation and should be the same as your build step.

inputs.name: targetTrustServerCertificate
inputs.label: Trust Server Certificate
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify whether SSL encryption is used by SQL Server when a certificate is installed.

inputs.name: targetEncrypt
inputs.label: Encrypt
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify whether to force SQL Server to skip certificate validation.

inputs.name: passwordSync
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password should reference a secret variable defined on the Variables tab.

inputs.name: filterPathSync
inputs.label: Filter path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to a .scpf filter file. Overrides any existing Filter.scpf file present in the source control repository, and is used when comparing and updating the target database. Filter files can be generated by SQL Source Control and SQL Compare.

inputs.name: compareOptionsSync
inputs.label: SQL Compare options
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify additional SQL Compare options, or remove default options. Comma separated list, prefix a default option with - to remove it.

inputs.name: dataCompareOptionsSync
inputs.label: SQL Data Compare options
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify additional SQL Data Compare options, or remove default options. Comma separated list, prefix a default option with - to remove it.

inputs.name: scriptFileSync
inputs.label: Script file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Write the update SQL to a file and upload it as an artifact. If you supply this optional argument, when the target is updated, the update SQL written is also written to the specified file.

inputs.name: abortOnWarningsSync
inputs.label: Abort on warnings
inputs.helpMarkDown: If there are deployment warnings at this level or higher, the target database will not be modified. The default value of 'None' means that warnings will be ignored.

inputs.name: transactionIsolationLevelSync
inputs.label: Transaction isolation level
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the Transaction Isolation Level to be used for the transactions during the sync operation. Set this to Read Committed or lower if you are experiencing difficulties with linked servers.

inputs.name: queryBatchTimeoutSync
inputs.label: Query batch timeout (in seconds)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The execution timeout in seconds, for each batch of queries in the update script. The default value is 30 seconds. A value of zero indicates no execution timeout.

inputs.name: nugetPackageVersionSelector
inputs.label: NuGet package version

options.BuildNumber: Use the full build number as the NuGet package version

inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the version number for each NuGet package, or use the full Build Number used in this Build Definition. This should be consistent across all SQL Change Automation build tasks.

inputs.name: nugetPackageVersion
inputs.label: NuGet package version
inputs.helpMarkDown: The version number in the NuGet package name. This should be consistent across all SQL Change Automation build tasks. For example: 2.1.

inputs.name: nugetPackageVersionUseBuildId
inputs.label: Append BuildId to the NuGet package version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Make the package version unique for each build by appending the BuildID to the NuGet package version

inputs.name: requiredVersionOfDlma
inputs.label: Required version of SQL Change Automation
inputs.helpMarkDown: By default the latest version of SQL Change Automation will be used. If you want to use a specific version you can specify it here.

inputs.name: requiredVersion
inputs.label: Specific version of SQL Change Automation to be used

inputs.name: ProxyUrl
inputs.label: Proxy URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: By default, no proxy is used when connecting to Powershell Gallery. Alternatively, a proxy URL can be specified here that can be used for Powershell Gallery.
